name.description: A filename or database conform dataset name.
name.title: Dataset Name

description.description: A free text description of the dataset.
examples: A dataset for the OEMetadata examples.
description.title: Dataset Description

id.description: A unique identifier (UUID/DOI) for the collection.
id.title: Dataset Identifier

@id.description: A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that links the resource via the OpenEnergyDatabus (DBpedia Databus).
@id.title: @Id

@context.description: Explanation of metadata keys in ontology terms.
@context.title: @context

name.description: A filename or database conform table name.
name.title: Name

topics.description: An array of predefined topics that correspond to the database schemas of the OEP.

items.description: The topics are used to group the data in the database.
items.title: Keyword

topics.title: Keywords

path.description: A unique identifier (URI/UUID/DOI) for the table or file.
path.title: Path

description.description: A description of the table. It should be usable as summary information for the table that is described by the metadata.
examples: Example table used to illustrate the OEMetadata structure and meaning.
description.title: Description

languages.description: An array of languages used within the described data structures (e.g. titles, descriptions) or metadata.

items.description: The language keys must follow the Standard IETF (BCP47) and can be repeated if more languages are used.
items.title: Language

languages.title: Languages

subject.description: An array of objects that references to the subjects of the resource in ontology terms.

name.description: A class label of the ontology term.
name.title: Subject Name

@id.description: A unique identifier (URI/IRI) of the ontology class.
@id.title: Subject Identifier

subject.title: Subject

keywords.description: An array of freely selectable keywords that help with searching and structuring.

items.description: The keyword are used and managed in the OEP as table tags.
items.title: Keyword

keywords.title: Keywords

publicationDate.description: A date of publication of the data or metadata. The date format is ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DD).
publicationDate.title: Publication Date

embargoPeriod.description: An object that describes the embargo period during which public access to the data is not allowed.

start.description: The start date of the embargo period. The date of the data (metadata) upload.
start.title: Embargo Period Start

end.description: The end date of the embargo period. This is the intended publication date.
end.title: Embargo Period End (Publication Date)

isActive.description: A boolean key that indicates if the embargo period is currently active. Must be changed to False on the embargo period end date.
isActive.title: Embargo Period is Active

embargoPeriod.title: Embargo Period

context.description: An Object that describes the general setting, environment or project leading to the creation or maintenance of this dataset. In science this can be the research project.

title.description: A title of the associated project.
title.title: Context Title

documentation.description: A URL of the project documentation.
documentation.title: Documentation

sourceCode.description: A URL of the source code of the project.
sourceCode.title: Source Code

publisher.description: The publishing agency of the data. This can be the OEP.
publisher.title: Publisher

publisherLogo.description: A URL to the logo of the publishing agency of data.
publisherLogo.title: Publisher Logo

contact.description: A reference to the creator or maintainer of the data set. This can be an email address or a GitHub handle.
contact.title: E-Mail Contact

fundingAgency.description: A name of the entity providing the funding. This can be a government agency or a company.
fundingAgency.title: Funding Agency

fundingAgencyLogo.description: A URL to the logo or image of the funding agency.
fundingAgencyLogo.title: Funding Agency Logo

grantNo.description: An identifying grant number. In case of a publicly funded project, this number is assigned by the funding agency.
grantNo.title: Grant Number

context.title: Context

spatial.description: An object that describes the spatial context of the data.

location.description: An object that describes a covered area or region.

address.description: An address of the location of the data. May be specified with street name, house number, zip code, and city name.
address.title: Address

@id.description: A path or URI to a specific location. It can use Wikidata or OpenStreetMap.
@id.title: Address Identifier

latitude.description: The latitude (lat) information of the location. Specifies the north / south position of the geometry.
latitude.title: Latitude

longitude.description: The longitude (lon) information of the location. Specifies the east / west position of the geometry.
longitude.title: Longitude

location.title: Extent

extent.description: An object that describes a covered area or region.

@id.description: A URI reference for the region.
@id.title: Extent Identifier

resolutionValue.description: The value of the spatial resolution.
resolutionValue.title: Spatial Resolution Value

resolutionUnit.description: The unit of the spatial resolution.
resolutionUnit.title: Spatial Resolution Unit

boundingBox.description: The covered area specified by the coordinates of a bounding box. The format is [minLon, minLat, maxLon, maxLat] or [W,S,E,N].
boundingBox.title: Bounding Box

crs.description: The Coordinate Reference System, specified as an EPSG code.
crs.title: Coordinate Reference System (CRS)

extent.title: Extent

spatial.title: Spatial

temporal.description: An object with the time period covered in the data. Temporal information should contain either a "referenceDate" or the keys that describe a time series, in rare cases both.

referenceDate.description: A base year, month or day. The time for which the data is should be accurate. Date Format is ISO 8601.
referenceDate.title: Reference Date

timeseries.description: An array that describe the timeseries.

start.description: The start time of a time series.
start.title: Timeseries Start

end.description: The temporal end point of a time series.
end.title: Timeseries End

resolutionValue.description: The time span between individual information points in a time series. The value of the resolution.
resolutionValue.title: Timeseries Resolution Value

resolutionUnit.description: The unit of the temporal resolution.
resolutionUnit.title: Timeseries Resolution Unit

alignment.description: An indicator of whether timestamps in a time series are to the left, right or in the centre.
alignment.title: Timeseries Alignment

aggregationType.description: An indicator of whether the values are a sum, an average or a current value.
aggregationType.title: Timeseries Aggregation Type

timeseries.title: Timeseries

temporal.title: Temporal

sources.description: An array of objects with the used and underlying sources of the data and metadata.

title.description: A human readable title of the source, a document title or organisation name.
examples: IPCC Sixth Assessment Report (AR6) - Climate Change 2023 - Synthesis Report
title.title: Source Title

authors.description: An array of the full names of the authors of the source material.
authors.title: Keywords

description.description: A free text description of the source.
examples: A Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change.
description.title: Source Description

publicationYear.description: Indicates the year when the work was published.
publicationYear.title: Publication Year

path.description: A DOI or link to the original source.
path.title: DOI

items.description: An array of objects of licenses under which the described source is provided. See https://openenergyplatform.github.io/academy/courses/08_licensing/ for further information.

title.description: The official (human readable) title of the license.
title.title: Title

path.description: A link or path to the license text.
path.title: License Identifier

instruction.description: A short description of rights and obligations. The use of tl;drLegal is recommended.
examples: You are free to share and change, but you must attribute. See https://tldrlegal.com/license/odc-open-database-license-odbl for further information.
instruction.title: Instruction

attribution.description: A copyright owner of the source. Must be provided if attribution licenses are used.
attribution.title: Attribution

copyrightStatement.description: A link or path that proves that the source or data has the appropriate license. This can be a page number or website imprint.
copyrightStatement.title: Copyright Statement

items.title: Licenses

sources.title: Sources

licenses.description: An array of objects of licenses under which the described data is provided.

title.description: The official (human readable) title of the license.
examples: Open Data Commons Open Database License 1.0
title.title: Title

path.description: A link or path to the license text.
path.title: Path

instruction.description: A short description of rights and obligations. The use of tl;drLegal is recommended.
examples: You are free to share and change, but you must attribute, and share derivations under the same license. See https://tldrlegal.com/license/odc-open-database-license-(odbl) for further information.
instruction.title: Instruction

attribution.description: A copyright holder of the data. Must be provided if attribution licenses are used.
attribution.title: Attribution

copyrightStatement.description: A link or path that proves that the source or data has the appropriate license. This can be a page number or website imprint.
copyrightStatement.title: Copyright Statement

licenses.title: Licenses

contributors.description: An array of objects of contributors and contributions to the data or metadata.

title.description: A full name of the contributor.
title.title: Contributor Title

path.description: A qualified link or path pointing to a relevant location online for the contributor. This can be the GitHub page or ORCID.
path.title: Path

organization.description: A string describing the organization this contributor is affiliated to. This can be relevant for the copyright.
organization.title: Organization

roles.description: An array describing the roles of the contributor.

items.description: A role is recommended to follow an established vocabulary, such as DataCite Metadata Schema’s contributorRole or CreDIT. Useful roles to indicate are: creator, contact, and dataCurator.
items.title: Role

roles.title: Roles

date.description: The date of the final contribution. Date Format is ISO 8601.
date.title: Date

object.description: The object of the contribution. Which part of the package was supplied or changed.
object.title: Object

comment.description: A free-text commentary on what has been done.
comment.title: Comment

contributors.title: Contributors

type.description: The 'table' type indicates that the resource is tabular as per 'Frictionless Tabular Data' definition.
type.title: Type

format.description: A file extension format. Possible options are 'csv', 'xlsx', 'json', 'PostgreSQL', 'SQLite' and other standard file extensions.
format.title: Format

encoding.description: Specifies the character encoding of the resource's data file. The default is 'UTF-8'. The values should be one of the 'Preferred MIME Names'.
encoding.title: Encoding

schema.description: An object that describes the structure of a table. It contains all fields (columns of the table), the primary key and optional foreign keys.

fields.description: An array of objects that describes a field (column) and its detailed information.

name.description: The name of the field. The name may only consist of lowercase alphanumeric characters or underscores. It must not begin with a number or an underscore.
name.title: Column Name

examples: Reference year for which the data was collected.
description.title: Description

type.description: The data type of the field. In case of a geom column in a database, also indicate the shape and CRS.
type.title: Type

nullable.description: A boolean key to specify that a column can be nullable. True is the default value.
nullable.title: Nullable

unit.description: The unit of a field. If it does not apply, use 'null'. If the unit is given in a separate field, reference this field (e.g. 'unit'). Use a space between numbers and units (100 m).
unit.title: Unit

isAbout.description: An array of objects that describes the field in ontology terms.

name.description: The class label of the ontology term.
name.title: Is About Name

@id.description: The path of the ontology term (IRI).
@id.title: Is About Identifier

isAbout.title: isAbout

valueReference.description: An array of objects for an extended description of the values in the column in ontology terms.

value.description: The name of the value in the column.
value.title: Value Reference

name.description: The class label of the ontology term in the column.
name.title: Value Reference Name

@id.description: The path of the ontology term (IRI) in the column.
@id.title: Value Reference Identifier

valueReference.title: valueReference

fields.title: Field

primaryKey.description: An array of fields that uniquely identifies each row in the table.

items.description: The default value is the “id” column.
items.title: Primary key

primaryKey.title: Primary key

items.description: An array of objects with foreign keys that describe a field that relates to a field in another table.

fields.description: An array of fields in the table that is constrained by the foreign key.

items.description: The column in the table that is constrained by the foreign key.
items.title: Foreign Key Field

fields.title: Fields

reference.description: The reference to the foreign table.
reference.title: Reference

items.title: Foreign Key

schema.title: Schema

dialect.description: The Dialect defines a simple format for describing the various dialects of CSV files in a language-independent manner. In a database, the values in the fields are 'null'.

delimiter.description: The delimiter specifies the character sequence which should separate fields (columns). Common characters are ',' (comma), ';' (semicolon), '.' (point) and '\t' (tab).
delimiter.title: Delimiter

decimalSeparator.description: The symbol used to separate the integer part from the fractional part of a number written in decimal form. Depending on language and region this symbol can be '.' or ','.
decimalSeparator.title: Decimal separator

dialect.title: Dialect

review.description: The metadata on the OEP can go through an open peer review process. See the Academy course [Open Peer Review](https://openenergyplatform.github.io/academy/courses/09_peer_review/) for further information.

path.description: A link or path to the documented open peer review.
path.title: Path

badge.description: A badge of either Iron, Bronze, Silver, Gold or Platinum is used to label the quality of the metadata.
badge.title: Badge

review.title: Review

metaMetadata.description: An object that describes the metadata themselves, their format, version and license.

metadataVersion.description: Type and version number of the metadata.
metadataVersion.title: Metadata Version

title.description: The official (human readable) title of the license.
title.title: License Title

path.description: A link or path to the license text.
path.title: License Path
